Lectures on Postsyntactic Morphology
Andrew Ira Nevins
February 2016
 

These lecture notes, used at the LSA 2015 Institute in Chicago and elsewhere, will be periodically updated (and like Don Knuth, I may begin a system of monetary payments for errors spotted!). They are meant to accompany live lectures that provide an introduction to Distributed Morphology and like all pedadogical material, must thereby make certain choices in what to emphasize and distill. The lecture notes will eventually be incorporated into a coauthored project with Karlos Arregi for a textbook on this topic.
